job_title: Community Organizer in Tigerton, WI
pros: Friendly and supportive staff to encourage personal growth
cons: Only can work during school year in student roles

job_title: IT Staff in De Pere, WI
pros: Great place, easy going people.
cons: Pay is awful and not realistic.

job_title: Cafeteria Worker in De Pere, WI
pros: You get to take home food at the end of the night, super-nice coworkers, and bosses.
cons: Pay is very low, but otherwise, it's a good place to work!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in De Pere, WI
pros: Size, location, reputation, leadership, cafeteria
cons: Limited opportunities for career advancement

review_title: Be cautious of closed minded Catholic College.
job_title: Assistant Professor in De Pere, WI
pros: If you are Catholic and are comfortable with the conservative nature of a small Catholic College. This is a true community, it feels like a family. It offers a chance to have real balance in work and family life. This is a place that you will have direct contact with the full spectrum of potential colleagues across field and specialties.
cons: This is not a place for Single people, progressives, gays, or most liberal academics. The Green Bay area is very gossipy and suspicious of outsiders. The students are hostile to professors who challenge them and illuminate the problems with the status quo. There are major climate issues related to race, class, and gender.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in De Pere, WI
pros: This college provides a wonderful community for its faculty.  I enjoy an excellent relationship with my colleagues and students.   Recent progress in the facilities on campus make the work environment increasingly pleasant and progressive.  Open-minded, liberal arts mentality.  Ask anyone on campus about "Communio" to get a sense of the hospitality and engagement.
cons: Limited number of available job openings, due to the size of the college.  I wish I could stay indefinitely, but the size of the department makes it unlikely that there will be a position available anytime in the next 10 years.

review_title: A college on the way up
job_title: Assistant Professor in West De Pere, WI
pros:
Supportive colleagues
Engaged, polite, and attentive students
Flexibility
Easy commute
Low cost of living
God work-life balance
cons: Although the school has become less stringently catholic, a non-catholic ma occasionally feel frustrated by the religious atmosphere. Also, Green Bay is a nice place to live in many ways, but it lacks some of the entertainment options you would find in a larger city.

review_title: It was fun working here but I wish it paid more based on the duties you are responsible for.
job_title: Student Worker ITS in Redmond, WA
pros: Great experience and they teach valuable skills such as report writing and various technical skills.  Allow students to move to different departments if help is needed and the student is interested.
cons: The work they ask you to accomplish is well above the pay they provide.  This is offset by the great experience gained but being paid a few more dollars an hour is always nice.

review_title: I have been a Library Student Assistant for the past three years at St. Norbert College.
job_title: Library Student Assistant in Seattle, WA
pros: Scheduling is very flexible, and the workload is not demanding. The other student workers are all very easy to get along with as well as the full time staff. Being on-campus is great too, since walking to work is efficient.
cons: I have had a really positive experience working here, so there aren't any complaints from my perspective.

job_title: Office Assistant in De Pere, WI
pros: Worked right on campus so I could walk to work in between classes. They were extremely flexible with my student/work lifestyle.  Favorite time of the year was "Thank-a-thon." Students who received scholarships from Alumni and constituents wrote thank you notes for the support.
cons: The work I did was a little monotonous but very interesting. Lots of filing of information and paper cuts!

review_title: I have loved transitioning from student to working alum at the institution.
job_title: Development Associate in De Pere, WI
pros: Beautiful campus that will continually grow. Also, provides great benefits
cons: As a recently graduated alum it often feels like I'm viewed as a student and not as a working professional.

review_title: Great college, great place to work
job_title: Director in De Pere, WI
pros: Welcoming community where people know the mission and live it out daily. Beautiful campus. Healthy institution. Great president. Quality education.
cons: Budget is too reliant on tuition.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in De Pere, WI
pros: Beautiful campus, wonderful community, people are friendly, students are engaged. Wonderful President.
cons: Too tuition dependent. Many decisions are made at the VP level with very limited communication downwards.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in De Pere, WI
pros: Very flexible,  they are very willing to work with you if there is an issue and the staff is also extremely friendly.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of.

job_title: Lead Operations Manager in De Pere, WI
pros: Good sense of community on a small, close-knit campus. Employers care about each and every employee and work to develop your abilities.
cons: limited parking, minimum wage for students in some positions

job_title: Assistant Programmer in De Pere, WI
pros: Very-Flexible environment, great employee's, genuinely interested in your success and life.
cons: Pay is little and projects can get intense, need to be a student of St. Norbert

job_title: in De Pere, WI

job_title: Service Desk Associate in De Pere, WI
pros: Friendly environment and wonderful staff, always trying to make working there a better experience for everyone.
